verses.verse: A Psalm <WH4210> of David, <WH1732> to bring to remembrance. <WH2142> O LORD, <WH3068> rebuke <WH3198> me not <WH408> in thy wrath: <WH7110> neither chasten <WH3256> me in thy hot displeasure. <WH2534>
For <WH3588> thine arrows <WH2671> stick fast <WH5181> in me, and thy hand <WH3027> presseth me sore. <WH5181> <WH5921>

There is no <WH369> soundness <WH4974> in my flesh <WH1320> because <WH4480> <WH6440> of thine anger; <WH2195> neither <WH369> is there any rest <WH7965> in my bones <WH6106> because <WH4480> <WH6440> of my sin. <WH2403>
For <WH3588> mine iniquities <WH5771> are gone over <WH5674> mine head: <WH7218> as a heavy <WH3515> burden <WH4853> they are too heavy <WH3513> for <WH4480> me.
My wounds <WH2250> stink <WH887> and are corrupt <WH4743> because <WH4480> <WH6440> of my foolishness. <WH200>
I am troubled; <WH5753> I am bowed down <WH7817> greatly; <WH5704> <WH3966> I go <WH1980> mourning <WH6937> all <WH3605> the day <WH3117> long.
For <WH3588> my loins <WH3689> are filled <WH4390> with a loathsome <WH7033> disease: and there is no <WH369> soundness <WH4974> in my flesh. <WH1320>
I am feeble <WH6313> and sore <WH5704> <WH3966> broken: <WH1794> I have roared <WH7580> by reason of the disquietness <WH4480> <WH5100> of my heart. <WH3820>
Lord, <WH136> all <WH3605> my desire <WH8378> is before <WH5048> thee; and my groaning <WH585> is not <WH3808> hid <WH5641> from <WH4480> thee.
My heart <WH3820> panteth, <WH5503> my strength <WH3581> faileth <WH5800> me: as for the light <WH216> of mine eyes, <WH5869> it <WH1992> also <WH1571> is gone <WH369> from <WH854> me.
My lovers <WH157> and my friends <WH7453> stand aloof <WH5975> from my sore; <WH4480> <WH5048> <WH5061> and my kinsmen <WH7138> stand <WH5975> afar off. <WH4480> <WH7350>

They also that seek after <WH1245> my life <WH5315> lay snares <WH5367> for me: and they that seek <WH1875> my hurt <WH7451> speak <WH1696> mischievous things, <WH1942> and imagine <WH1897> deceits <WH4820> all <WH3605> the day <WH3117> long.
But I, <WH589> as a deaf <WH2795> man, heard <WH8085> not; <WH3808> and I was as a dumb man <WH483> that openeth <WH6605> not <WH3808> his mouth. <WH6310>
Thus I was <WH1961> as a man <WH376> that <WH834> heareth <WH8085> not, <WH3808> and in whose mouth <WH6310> are no <WH369> reproofs. <WH8433>
For <WH3588> in thee, O LORD, <WH3068> do I hope: <WH3176> thou <WH859> wilt hear, <WH6030> O Lord <WH136> my God. <WH430>
For <WH3588> I said, <WH559> Hear me, lest <WH6435> otherwise they should rejoice <WH8055> over me: when my foot <WH7272> slippeth, <WH4131> they magnify <WH1431> themselves against <WH5921> me.
For <WH3588> I <WH589> am ready <WH3559> to halt, <WH6761> and my sorrow <WH4341> is continually <WH8548> before <WH5048> me.
For <WH3588> I will declare <WH5046> mine iniquity; <WH5771> I will be sorry <WH1672> for my sin. <WH4480> <WH2403>
But mine enemies <WH341> are lively, <WH2416> and they are strong: <WH6105> and they that hate <WH8130> me wrongfully <WH8267> are multiplied. <WH7231>
They also that render <WH7999> evil <WH7451> for <WH8478> good <WH2896> are mine adversaries; <WH7853> because <WH8478> I follow <WH7291> the thing that good <WH2896> is.
Forsake <WH5800> me not, <WH408> O LORD: <WH3068> O my God, <WH430> be not <WH408> far <WH7368> from <WH4480> me.
Make haste <WH2363> to help <WH5833> me, O Lord <WH136> my salvation. <WH8668>
